title: Synthetic Recap
body:
SAN FRANCISCO — In the dead of night, against the defending champions, Hakeem Olajuwon delivered a performance for the ages.

The Houston Rockets, fueled by the sheer will of their legendary center, outlasted the Golden State Warriors 90-85 in a grind-it-out defensive battle. But the final score is merely a footnote to the historic, 42-point masterpiece painted by Olajuwon in the paint.

From the opening tip, this was The Dream’s personal showcase. He was an unstoppable force, a whirlwind of footwork and finesse that the Warriors simply had no answer for. Each turn-around jumper, each powerful post move, and each graceful hook shot chipped away at Golden State’s resolve. His 42 points were not just a number; they were a relentless, four-quarter assault that carried his team on his back.

While Olajuwon dominated the scoring, the game was a tense, low-scoring affair. Latrell Sprewell provided a valiant counter-punch for the Warriors, fighting for every one of his team-high 22 points. But even his efforts, combined with Chris Mullin’s 15, could not overcome the tidal wave of Olajuwon.

The Rockets’ supporting cast played their part perfectly, feeding the beast in the middle and locking down defensively when it mattered most. Clyde Drexler, though quiet from the field, contributed everywhere else with 9 rebounds and 7 assists, facilitating the offense that ran through Olajuwon.

In the end, this was more than a regular-season victory. It was a statement. On a night where points were at a premium, Hakeem Olajuwon reached a legendary plateau, reminding the basketball world of his singular greatness and powering the Rockets to a hard-fought road win.
